text:
🐄🐂Wallace Education Centre was a former cow shed which had been repurposed into an education gallery showcasing the rich biogeography and biodiversity of the Dairy Farm Nature Park area.
🐄The airy and spacious hall exhibits well illustrated storyboards, including the time honoured cow statues.

🐄🐖Fun facts:
🐖Wallace Education Centre was originally a pig farm.
An epidemic of swine fever kill almost all of the pigs.
🐄Fred Heron, the MD of Cold Storage decided to convert it to a milk farm to supply high quality fresh milk in Singaoore.
The Dairy Farm stop operating in the 1970s.
🪴The area then went through several changes from growing vegetables to tabacco, then to orchids.
🥀A horticulture company occupied the area from 1981 to 2006, before NParks took over and eventually reopened as Dairy Farm Nature Park.

It has taught me a lot about the park, the history about it and the species in the park.  It has also taught me about how much research is going on in this area and some of the improvements that the have made in this area. It is located inside the nature reserve and has a toilet nearby for those who climbed this far.  A great educational place and would definitely come again.
After a long hike this was a good place to take a break. There is a water fountain, and a sheltered area if there's rain.

Beautiful place for all light hearted people who loves nature and birding. A nature reserve that suit all young and old...for biking, jogging, brisk walking and an education center that educate the young on nature understanding.
This can be part of your trekking route from either Bukit Timah Hill or MacRitchie as a resting point. Especially when you need the toilets - they are very clean and airy 👍
